newsitem.title: PERU: U.S. anti-drug head visits Peru crop projects.
newsitem.headline: U.S. anti-drug head visits Peru crop projects.

text.p: U.S. anti-drug chief Barry McCaffrey visited U.S.-funded alternative crop programmes in Peru's lush River Apurimac valley on Tuesday with Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori.
McCaffrey and Fujimori inspected projects to encourage local farmers to substitute fields of coca, the raw product for cocaine, for other products like cocoa, coffee, cotton and corn.
Peru is the world's largest grower of coca leaf, accounting for more than two-thirds of total production.
McCaffrey, a former commander-in-chief of the United States Southern Command, arrived in Lima late on Monday from Panama and is due to return to the United States on Wednesday night.
He said a proposal by Panama's government to turn a U.S. military base in Panama into an international centre to fight drug trafficking deserved serious study.
